intro: Anemone coronaria var. chrysanthemifolia, commonly known as the golden anemone, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its showy, yellow to orange flowers that resemble chrysanthemums, hence its common name. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with basal leaves that are palmately lobed and hairy. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in rocky or coastal habitats. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and is commonly cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
